title: Explain my Grade?

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body: I don't understand why I didn't get an S. Could someone fill me in please?

replies.body: it goes off averages for kda/cs ward placement etc so if you work on all of these the s ranks will flow

Greetings StealthVortex88,

I think that I might be able to lend a hand in understanding why you didn't get the mastery rank that you were after. 

Currently Riot has not released a lot of information on how the mastery system works because they don't want people farming for specific stats such as KDA or CS for example. However they have said that doing things that help win the game will help you get a higher mastery rank.

---

From this generally what I like to do in this situation is think about what I could have done better in the game and helped out my team more as it can be a good way to think about the mastery system. Maybe it is the case that you could have died less, gotten a few more kills, placed more wards or taken an extra tower or two. 

So think back to this game that you played and see if you can find areas that you could have played better and improved on from that game. S ranks can be hard to get sometimes and often require you to really be doing a lot to help your team win the game. So if it is the case that you didn't get an S rank, find a way that you could have done better and use it as a mark to help you improve your gameplay.

---

If you would like to look at Riot's specific statement about what they have said for getting a mastery rank, you can have a look here:

> **What is in the champ mastery grades formula?**
The grades you receive are driven by how you rank against all other players in your region who also played your champion and position across various performance categories. We don’t reveal the exact formula so that it can’t be min-maxed as we really want to avoid incentivizing playing for stats like CS or K/D/A rather than playing to win. However, the variables are fairly intuitive in terms of what you would expect to be important to winning.

> -Riot Socrates, Lead Game Designer

---

If there is anything I can clarify on with this let me know or if there are any other questions that you have let me know as well. Good luck in your games :3

~Elam
CS needs to be higher. I've had games where I go 20/0 with shit cs and get A+ and games with a score more like yours but very good cs and get S+. CS matters a lot.
